oha.shakkiproggis

Class PieceGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • oha.shakkiproggis.PieceGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PiecesToStartingFormation

    public class PieceGroup
extends Object
implements PiecesToStartingFormation
    This represents a pieceset. can be white or black. This is immutable object. When a move is done, new one is generated.
    Author:
    pyry

    • Constructor Detail

      • PieceGroup

        public PieceGroup(boolean color,
                  PawnPromoChooser pc)
        default constructor.
        Parameters:
        color - black or white.
        pc - pawn promo chooser object.

      • PieceGroup

        public PieceGroup(EnumMap<Square,PieceT> sqPtMap,
                  EnumMap<PieceT,PieceObj> pTpMap,
                  Square kingSq,
                  boolean[] castling,
                  Optional<Square> epp,
                  PawnPromoChooser pc)
        This constructor is used to generate new piecegroups from old ones.
        Parameters:
        sqPtMap - squares to piece types map.
        pTpMap - piece types to piece objects map.
        kingSq - king's square.
        castling - boolean that tell if castling is possible.
        epp - enpassantable pawn's square.
        pc - pawn promotion target chooser object.

    • Method Detail

      • squares

        public Stream<Square> squares()
        Player's occupied squares.
        Returns:
        a stream of squares occupied by pieces of this player.

      • attacksTo

        public Stream<Square> attacksTo(PieceGroup enemy)
        Squares that are under our attack.
        Parameters:
        enemy - other players pieces
        Returns:
        Squares that can be attacked by this pieceGroups pieces. Also empty squares.

      • kingInCheck

        public boolean kingInCheck(PieceGroup enemy)
        Is our important king in check.
        Parameters:
        enemy - other player's pieces
        Returns:
        true if this player's king is in check.

      • moveMyPiece

        public PieceGroup moveMyPiece(Square a,
                              Square b)
        Moves my piece.
        Parameters:
        a - starting square
        b - ending square
        Returns:
        new pieceGroup in which square A has mutated to B.

      • eatOneOfMyPieces

        public PieceGroup eatOneOfMyPieces(Square a,
                                   Square b,
                                   PieceGroup eater)
        Kills my piece if there is one on the square b.
        Parameters:
        a - starting point of the enemy move.
        b - end point of the enemy move.
        eater - type of piece who moved there.
        Returns:
        new piece set with the same pieces on same locations. maybe one piece is missing or is not.

      • moves

        public Stream<Square> moves(Square s,
                            PieceGroup enemy)
        Possile moves of my pieces.
        Parameters:
        s - starting square
        enemy - other player
        Returns:
        all the squares in which this piece can move
